events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 28th involving their sedan and another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' based on the details provided of the car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle customer communications and process the claim for the vehicle accident.
The customer received formal acknowledgment of the claim filing along with preliminary information about the claim process.
Request was sent to the customer asking for photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and proof of insurance.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos of the car damage and the official police accident report.
The investigation team began assessing the claim, reviewing submitted documents and contacting involved parties for further information.
Investigation concluded, confirming the extent of the damages and liability for the auto accident as reported.
Insurance company proposed a fair settlement amount covering repairs and rental car fees to the customer.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely communication throughout.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department, authorizing the payment based on the agreed settlement.
Settlement payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s bank account to cover the repair costs for the damaged vehicle.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following confirmation that the payment was received and repairs completed.
